question.body: If you connected the beakers with a tube that was permeable to water but impermeable to glucose, which way would water move?

multiple_choice.choice: From beaker A to beaker B
From beaker B to beaker A

response.feedback: Correct. The hypertonic solution in B would pull water toward it.
Incorrect. Beaker A has fewer solutes than beaker B.
Incorrect. The fluids are not isotonic, water will move to the hypertonic fluid.

part.hint: Only water can pass through the membrane. Which solution has a higher osmolarity to pull water?
